name: CbcSymmetry
brief:
Symmetry detection and orbital branching using nauty
Authors: Pietro Belotti (Lehigh), Andreas Waechter (IBM)
Adapted from Couenne (Carnegie-Mellon University, 2006-11)
This file is licensed under the Eclipse Public License (EPL)

CbcSymmetry: Detects problem symmetry and exploits it for faster solving.
Uses the nauty library for automorphism group computation.

algorithms.name:
Orbital Branching - CbcOrbitalBranchingObject:
  branch() exploits symmetry to avoid symmetric subtrees:
  1. Down branch: Fix x_column = 0, all orbit members = 0.
  2. Up branch: Fix x_column = 1.
  Breaks symmetry: symmetric nodes pruned implicitly.
algorithms.math:
Automorphism group:
  Aut(G) = {π : V → V | π preserves edges and colors}.
  |Aut(G)| can be exponential; nauty computes generators.
  Orbit O(v) = {π(v) : π ∈ Aut(G)} - equivalence class.

Key concepts:
- Orbits: Sets of symmetric variables
- Orbital fixing: If one variable in orbit is fixed, fix others by symmetry
- Orbital branching: Branch to break symmetry

Build requirements (when CBC_HAS_NAUTY defined):
- nauty library (configure with --enable-tls --enable-wordsize=32)
- Add -DCBC_HAS_NAUTY and -DNTY_TRACES (optional) to CXXDEFS
- Link with -lnauty

Runtime: Use -orbit on to enable

CbcNauty: Wrapper for nauty graph automorphism library.
Handles graph construction, partition refinement, and orbit computation.

CbcOrbitalBranchingObject: Branching object that exploits symmetry.
On one branch, fix variable to 1 and symmetric variables to 0.
